conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation for Interruption
conditions.description: Liver function test result triggering temporary dose interruption.
conditions.text: ALT or AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation for Discontinuation
conditions.description: Liver function test result triggering permanent dose discontinuation.

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease for Dose Reduction
conditions.description: Significant neutrophil decrease from baseline triggering dose reduction.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Hy's Law Condition
conditions.description: Combination of bilirubin and ALT elevation indicative of liver injury, triggering temporary interruption.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3x ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening triggering evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening triggering evaluation for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Confirmation of pregnancy is a criterion for study intervention discontinuation.
conditions.text: Participant becomes pregnant or plans to become pregnant.

conditions.name: Use of Disallowed Medication
conditions.description: Use of disallowed medication is a criterion for study intervention discontinuation.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 30 mg/day, following a safety review of data through Day 23. Participants may remain on 15 mg/day if there are safety concerns.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT/AST Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Requires weekly repeat testing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Discontinuation for ALT/AST Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 5x ULN, permanently discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Toxicity
transitionRules.text: If Platelets < 100,000/mm3 OR Neutrophils < 1500/mm3 OR Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline, reduce dose to previous level or to 15 mg QOD. Requires weekly repeat testing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Requires weekly repeat testing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on evidence of neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of Study Intervention
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After Dose Modification
transitionRules.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed after dose interruption or reduction for safety events.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (EOS Visit on Day 54 +/- 2 days).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered lost to follow-up if they repeatedly fail to return for visits and cannot be contacted after multiple attempts (3 phone calls and a certified letter).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor/Investigator Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time. Reasons may include investigator non-compliance, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day based on review of safety data through Day 23 by the Safety Review Committee.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decision points based on safety monitoring (lab results, AEs) that may trigger dose modification or discontinuation as per protocol criteria.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Study Intervention Discontinuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to permanently discontinue a participant from the study intervention based on specific criteria such as severe lab abnormalities, pregnancy, or use of disallowed medications.
